answers.answer: you need an eye exam.  diabetics have all kinds of eye problems, including RAPIDLY CHANGING glasses rx.  the reason your glasses hurt your head is probably b/c that is not your rx anymore.get an exam & new glasses

I too have Diabetes . I know when my BG is out of control my eyesight gets blurry. I also have night blindness....I was diagnosed with cataracts three years ago,  they grew pretty fast and had new lens put in a few months ago...I was told the Diabetes could have caused the fast growth and that the cataracts could also be the cause of my night driving problems...I don't know since I haven't driven at night since the surgery. If I were you I would go and have a complete eye exam....Are you getting your retinas checked at least yearly...very important for Diabetics:).

question: I am 41 and was diagnosed almost three yrs ago with Type II Diabetes.  While i am being treated for this, it has been quite difficult to get my blood sugars under control.  I have glasses because of nearsightedness, but honestly I do not wear them any longer due to the tremendous headaches they now casue me.  I put them on and after an hour, my head is pounding so badly I am grabbing my migraine medicine to help me through it.For the last almost year, I have been having great difficulty driving at night.  The oncoming headlights, the headlights in my rearview mirror and sometimes just traffic lights and parking lot lights cause pain in my eyes and literally blinds me until the light passes.  Two nights ago I had to "soft crash" into the wooded area along a dark road because the oncoming headlights from a vehicle blinded me and I could not see the lines of the road.  This has now scared me so much I refuse to drive.  Does my diabetes have anything to do with this problem?  I have attempted to use my glasses when I drive but that has not given me any relief, just gives me another headache.  I realize that I must make an appt with my dr, but I am just concerned if this is serious enough to where I will not be able to drive at night?Thank you for reading my post and have a great day.
title: Vision problems when driving
